entry.title: [scroll-gutter] Remove unreachable code in RequiresScrollableArea
entry.content:
This logic was introduced in:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2404233



When the "force" value could apply to non-scrollers. See:

https://web.archive.org/web/20200704215227/https://drafts.csswg.org/css-overflow-4/#scrollbar-gutter-property



However scrollbar-gutter (now) only applies to scrollable containers

which should be covered by the branch "IsScrollContainer" in the

function.



See:

https://drafts.csswg.org/css-overflow-3/#propdef-scrollbar-gutter



Change-Id: I6da09d756afd565eb4d94df50a9d4a66a01bdd85

entry.title: graphite: Use GpuPreferences Dawn toggles in DawnContextProvider
entry.content:
Use the Dawn toggles passed via GpuPreferences i.e. from command line

flags --enable/disable-dawn-features. This allows passing useful toggles

for debugging such as use_user_defined_labels_in_backend for release

builds. This should also allow enabling validation in release builds by

passing --disable-dawn-features=skip_validation since enabled toggles

are processed first before disabled toggles.



This change also makes the --enable_dawn_backend_validation flag the

source of truth for backend validation level as opposed to the previous

behavior of always enabling full backend validation for dcheck builds.

This is desirable because many GPU bot configs run dcheck builds and

using full backend validation will slow them down a lot.



Bug: 1471235

Change-Id: Iadf290056db08b1abeb708d9e2d3a69ace45fbe9

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4776133

Reviewed-by: Peng Huang

Commit-Queue: Peng Huang

Auto-Submit: Sunny Sachanandani

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1182883}

entry.title: Reliable scroll hit test with opaque-to-hit-test layer
entry.content:
When a layer's scroll parent is different from the first scroller in

layer order, previously we treated scroll-begins in such a layer

unreliable because whether to scroll the scroll parent or the first

scroller in layer order depends on the hit test opaqueness of the

layer, and the compositor didn't have the information. Now the

compositor can reliably scroll the scroll parent if the layer is known

to be opaque to hit test. This CL is effective when the feature

HitTestOpaqueness is enabled.



Bug: 1413877

Change-Id: I9d55be570165b69f493c108bcfa5fe5e65f82a66

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4763293

Reviewed-by: Steve Kobes

entry.content:
Today lacros shares the same ScreenCaptureNotificationUI impl

(screen_capture_notification_ui_views) with non-chromeOS platforms,

i.e. it displays a notification bar which appears as a separate

window in overview mode on ChromeOS; it's the issue this cl is about to

address.

ScreenCaptureNotificationUILacros that no longer displays a notification

entry.title: Use native fling curve inside large snap areas.
entry.content:
SnapFlingController can intercept a fling if it finds a valid snap

target. But inside a snap area that covers the viewport, every offset

is a valid snap target.



Letting SFC control these flings displaced "native" (browser-side) fling

physics in favor of settling the scroll at a distance provided by

SnapFlingCurve::EstimateDisplacement, which is 40x the delta in the

first inertial GestureScrollUpdate. This feels like molasses.



Instead, tell SFC to ignore flings that are estimated to settle inside a

snap area that covers the viewport, unless the current event's actual

delta would take us outside the snap area (see comments in test).



Bug: 1420413

Change-Id: Ie15afe4ad829ee5a64afd0da435c35aa6a279d47

entry.title: IndexedDB: fix flakiness in database metadata initialization
entry.content:
Grab a lock for the database when initializing metadata from the

backing store.



Previous to this change, the metadata for an `IndexedDBDatabase`

object would be read from the backing store (or generated and written

into the backing store, if the database didn't already exist) just

after construction. However the record for that database's metadata,

which contains the version among other info, may be in flux. That is,

a previous connection to the database may have left behind changes

that haven't been fully written. (See bug for exact details.) Thus

the read must be guarded by acquiring the same lock that is used to

write the metadata record.



Bug: 1472028

Change-Id: I373ffa7696b0976efcb544be13dc09ac9b487049

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4771933

entry.title: Make Length-resolving functions from SVGLengthContext free functions
entry.content:
Said functions only depend on SVGViewportResolver for resolving

percentages. Since creating a SVGViewportResolver is slightly ergonomic

in most cases - especially when there's a LayoutObject available since

it then avoids the To(...) - move these functions out from

SVGLengthContext, making them free.



Add an additional helper for the case when a pair of Lengths should

resolve to a point.



Move SVGViewportResolver and the functions to a separate file, and clean

up the related includes a bit.



Bug: 1411691

entry.title: [Fuchsia] Fine tuning fuchsia-code-coverage builder
entry.content:
This change adjusted fuchsia-code-coverage to hopefully make it green.

1) All/SitePerProcessBrowserTest.AccessWindowProxyOfCrashedFrameAfterNavigation

is failing consistently recently. But it's passing on rel and dbg

builders. Likely the root cause is either crash due to OOM or race

condition. But since this is the coverage builder, skipping it would

be the easiest solution.

2) Further increase the sharding of content_browsertests and

web_engine_integration_test, both of them still have a certain chance

of failing due to the OOM. The retrying indeed wastes more resources.

It would be more meaningful to allocate more shards upfront.



Change-Id: I2ad138b346597c0088b9cb65791deea30bb2267f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4754619

Commit-Queue: Zijie He

Reviewed-by: Gary Tong

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1182851}

entry.title: [Extensions] Track active service worker keepalives
entry.content:
Track active service worker keepalives in the ProcessManager. This

will both allow us to audit this state (e.g., exposing it in

chrome://extensions-internals) and allows us to add strong CHECKs

to verify call validity (e.g., that a UUID corresponds to a valid

entry).



Add a basic end-to-end browsertest for the same.



Followup CLs will utilize these more fully (such as hooking into

extensions-internals).



Bug: 1471696

> Reason for revert: Suspicious about causing test failures of:

> > Migrate single threaded tests to virtual test suite

> > This change switches from using a list of tests that should run single

> > threaded (SingleThreadedTests) to a VirtualTestSuite approach. This is

> > being done to support a longer-term effort to use virtual tests upstream

entry.title: Reland "Extract high quality images from PDF only when they are needed for OCR."
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 5208eafb234ba2af392851bc75e2dbac8ca288e2.

Fixed the build issue by moving the definition of

`TestPdfAccessibilityTree` out of BUILDFLAG(ENABLE_SCREEN_AI_SERVICE)

and wrapping only necessary class functions and members with the

buildflag.



Original change's description:

> Extract high quality images from PDF only when they are needed for OCR.

>

> 32-bit bitmaps with highest available quality are extracted from PDF

> files when they are loaded, so that they would be sent later to OCR

> service. To avoid the memory overhead of this process, this CL

> postpones image extraction to the time they are sent to OCR service,

> and destroys the extracted images immediately after that.

entry.title: Behind a flag, route notifications from PWAs through app shims on macOS.
entry.content:
When notifications are associated with a PWA, this routes the

notification to the corresponding app shim process rather than

chrome or its alert helper app. Currently this only works if the

app shim is already running (otherwise notifications end up in the

void), and also is missing any kind of cleanup of "dispatchers" that

are no longer needed. Finally in its current form this breaks

getting all displayed notifications for PWAs. All of those will

be addressed in follow-up CLs.

entry.title: Add support for ampersand in NativeMessaging host path in Windows
entry.content:
Before the change, cmd was launching the NativeMessaging host as following:



C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe /d /c "C:\path\a&b.exe" chrome-extension://knldjmfmopnpolahpmmgbagdohdnhkik/ --parent-window=0



The command was failing due to an error because of the ampersand.



With the change, the command is the following:



C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe /d /s /c ""C:\path\a&b.exe" chrome-extension://knldjmfmopnpolahpmmgbagdohdnhkik/ --parent-window=0"



With the new command, the exe launches and works.



This change also allows `LaunchNativeHostViaCmd` to support several arguments

with spaces. cmd has complicated quote stripping rules, making some commands

fail with the current flags. For example, the following command:



cmd /d /c "C:\Program Files\Chrome\chrome.exe" "C:\New Folder\test.html"



Is equivalent to typing the following in cmd:



C:\Program Files\Chrome\chrome.exe" "C:\New Folder\test.html



Which fails with an error.



This change adds the /s flag which always strips the first and last quote. Note

that this doesn't affect Chromium as `LaunchNativeHostViaCmd` is never used with

arguments with spaces.



Bug: 335558

Change-Id: I1a1b7e58db98378f8945bff2ad0419e7ae6b4a85

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4720925

Reviewed-by: Sergey Ulanov

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1182828}

entry.title: Extend Lens histogram support and remove incorrect owners.
entry.content:
The histogram is tied to two sources:

1) QuickActionSearchWidget - which attempts to use Lens if it was

previously evaluated that Lens is available, and

2) Lens feature flags, that determine whether Lens functionality

can be used at runtime.



The widget does what Lens team asked us to do - we define a new entry

point and allow Lens team to track their metrics.



Removing self from owners: Search/Omnibox has no interest in this

metric.

entry.title: [AppLaunchAutomation] Fix Apps Cache Race Condition
entry.content:
Fixes an issue where the admin template service attempts to

parse a template before the apps cache will resolve browser ids

resulting in data loss on that template. This is done by

observing the apps cache to determine when it is in a state that

it will be ready.



TESTED: AdminTemplateServiceTest.*

entry.title: Reland "[Auto-disable Accessibility] Add histograms for feature usage"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 156236164fc352a3b02b4e2bdaedeb36fee16dd5

which was reverted here: crrev.com/c/4769364



Original change's description:

> [Auto-disable Accessibility] Add histograms for feature usage

>

> This CL continues the work of the Auto-disable accessibility feature

> in preparation of enabling the feature for A/B testing.

>

> With this CL we add histograms to track usage of the feature. We will

> track how often we enable/disable the feature, and how long the given

> instance was in the current state before changing (e.g. how long was

> accessibility enabled before being auto-disabled, or, how long was

> accessibility disabled before re-enabling). We also separate these

> into initial and successive categories to separate the first call for

> each instance from any later calls.

>

> AX-Relnotes: N/A

entry.title: desks: Fix window out of bounds in the mini view
entry.content:
The CL fixes the bug that after applying Jelly, when the focus ring with

active_desk_color_id on the active desk, if there is any window placed

on any corner of the root window, the mirror layer of the window will

have overlap with the focus ring.



When applying the `--ui-slow-animations` arg, we can see that at the

time when the entering overview mode animation complete, the right

angles are applied to mirrored windows; while before the animation

ending, the mirrored window has the corner radius. We let it not synced

with its source layer for the rounded corner for the animation.



Before the fix: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1yFQIGJj4QzamSUVEDfRWE05DG92GykPC/view?usp=sharing&resourcekey=0-0NDR_k3u_4JSQ0p3RXJZzA

After the fix: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/6k3H5cjHU9zAcyd



Bug: b/293946863

entry.title: Call CompositorViewHolder#onContentChanged when hiding Start
entry.content:
If the Start Surface was showing, the ContentView for the currently

selected Tab behind the Start Surface may not yet be attached and

therefore the Tab may not be interactive. Notify CompositorViewHolder

that content has changed when hiding Start for an inbound View intent, which will cause the Tab's ContentView to be attached.

entry.title: Add indexing-exclusions.txt
entry.content:
tools/symsrc/indexing-exclusions.txt contains a list of directories that

source indexing should ignore. Currently this contains just one

directory, but having that entry avoids 297 calls to "git log" for files

that aren't controlled by git, and that, for some reason, saves almost

two hours. The non-comment lines in this file are read by the

pdb_processing.py script in the recipe and then passed to

source_index.py.



This change also adds a comment in source_index.py to make this

discoverable, and updates the link to the recipe code.



This relies on:

https://chrome-internal-review.googlesource.com/c/chrome/tools/release/scripts/+/6303779

entry.title: [Auto-disable Accessibility] Deprecate the old isTouchExplorationEnabled method
entry.content:
This CL continues the work of consolidating accessibility state to a

single source in Clank.



With this CL we update all callers of isTouchExplorationEnabled to the

equivalent method in AccessibilityState. For some methods we instead

migrate to isScreenReaderEnabled, since it more accurately represents

the condition that was meant to be checked. We keep the original method

in place but add a @Deprecated annotation to discourage use.

entry.title: [Privacy Sandbox] Fix attestations file path.
entry.content:
NOTE: crrev.com/c/4708183 should be merged before merging this CL.



While doing the work to add the histogram for memory usage of the

attestations map, I notice the parsed map is always empty.



The issue is the install path passed to LoadAttestations() is the

directory of the installation folder, not the file.



Why this is not caught by test? In unit tests, we create a temporary

file and directly pass its path to LoadAttestations().



1. Added a browser test to cover the entire workflow, from browser

starts to attestations map is assigned.



2. Renamed GetInstalledPath() to GetInstalledFilePath()



3. Renamed argument install_dir to installed_file_path for

LoadAttestations().



4. Provide a few testing only helper functions to avoid too many

friend test classes declarations.



I will revisit the parsing time UMA and check if there is any change

needed.



Bug: 1448875, 1468578, 1464226

Change-Id: I08feb89ce0f40e7b8f9c0cf88571cdcb584d100b

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4729911

Reviewed-by: Joshua Pawlicki

Commit-Queue: Xiaochen Zhou

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1182793}

entry.title: Make Live Translate preferences non-syncable
entry.content:
This CL makes the Live Translate preferences non-syncable. Enabling sync

on Stable and Dev and then enabling these preferences on Dev will

entry.title: Support some commands in PWAs when no windows are open on Mac.
entry.content:
Currently it is not possible to have a PWA app shim running

without any windows open, but this changes with the

AppShimNewCloseBehavior feature. With that feature enabled and

no app windows open, it is a bit weird if the "new window" and

"app settings" menu items are disabled/don't work, so this CL

enables those commands and makes them work even when no windows

are open.



In case of multi-profile PWAs, opening settings currently picks

a profile fairly arbitrary (using similar logic to what is used

to determine what profile to open a new app launch in), which

feels like pretty reasonable behavior to me.



Bug: 1466216, 1466217

Change-Id: Ia84e59d7b684c91d50ab92b7e204a04d6eb84145

entry.title: [CrOS Hotspot] Reorder hotspot tile in QS
entry.content:
Connectivity team had a discussion with QS team on the position of the

hotspot tile, and decide to go with order: Network -> Capture Mode ->

Do not Disturb -> Bluetooth -> Cast/Auto rotate -> Accessibility ->

Hotspot -> ...

Documented at https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1sEw8fTjvy6xLS24ZYsgR_NhU-JVRhUnH3oIk8UMeKa0/edit?resourcekey=0-sHiJQlHoPmys_OHKWGLRiA#slide=id.g21421639906_0_1

entry.content:

Chrome. Here the format passed in can be multiplanar where the buffer

entry.title: [SetupList] Fix sync item shown when sync disabled by policy
entry.content:
Bug fix, landed only behind the set up list flag.

The UI says "Sign in with your Google Account to sync your bookmarks,

history, and more". That's not true if:

- SyncDisabled policy is in place -> Completely disables the sync

layer.

- SyncTypesListDisabled disables the data types mentioned in the string.

To simplify we agreed with PMs to hide the setup list whenever any

types are disabled in this way.

entry.title: Send null model when model is stopped serving
entry.content:
This CL sends null model update to observers when model was stopped to be served from the server, and removed from store.



When this null update happens, TFLiteModelExecutor will unload the previous model file, and stop using the model for subsequent inference.



Subsequent CL will fix the model observers from other components (translate, text_classifier) to unload the previous model file.



Subsequent CL from segmentation team will delete their metadata when such null model update happens.

entry.title: Augment unit tests with `alphaType` and `SkPreMultiplyARGB` coverage.
entry.content:
This CL augments `//ui/gfx/codec/png_codec_unittest.cc` to provide

missing test coverage for the following pieces of code from

`png_codec.cc`:



Piece of code number 1: Premultiplying color values by the alpha value:



```

void ConvertRGBARowToSkia(png_structp png_ptr,

png_row_infop row_info,

png_bytep data) {

...

for (unsigned char* p = data; p < end; p += channels) {

...

if (alpha != 255) {

state->is_opaque = false;

*sk_pixel = SkPreMultiplyARGB(alpha, p[0], p[1], p[2]);

} else {

*sk_pixel = SkPackARGB32(alpha, p[0], p[1], p[2]);

}

}

}

```



Piece of code number 2: Setting of `alphaType`:



```

bool PNGCodec::Decode(const unsigned char* input, size_t input_size,

SkBitmap* bitmap) {

...

bitmap->setAlphaType(state.is_opaque ?

kOpaque_SkAlphaType : kPremul_SkAlphaType);

...

}

```



Additionally this CL makes some minor tweaks to improve debuggability

of test failure - for example logging the values of unexpected pixels.

entry.content:
It adds the File type box and random access box.



file type box has major brand od 'mp41', and compatible

brands of mp4a and avc1. More feedbacks are required for

proper compatible brands though.



MFRA box has random access box that help demuxer to locate

the sync sample of (video) faster.

FTYP is file type box that should exist in the MP4 container.

MFRA is fragment random access box that is the last in the

file. It has sync sample location in each fragment so that

it can help demux.

entry.title: wallpaper: fullscreen preview in tablet splitscreen
entry.content:
During split screen, changes to the window state such as exiting full

screen or minimizing/maximizing windows will lead to

`WallpaperController:OnOverviewModeWillStart` triggering and canceling

the wallpaper preview mode. This makes the order of calls matter where

we need to confirm or cancel the wallpaper preview first before calling

to change the window state.



Sequence before this CL:

1. Open wallpaper picker in split screen

2. Click on confirming preview wallpaper

3. Exit fullscreen is triggered

4. `OnOverviewModeWillStart()` is called, canceling the preview

wallpaper

5. `ConfirmPreviewWallpaper()` becomes no-op



Sequence after this CL:

1. Open wallpaper picker in split screen

2. Click on confirming preview wallpaper

3. `ConfirmPreviewWallpaper()` is called, setting the wallpaper

4. Exit fullscreen is triggered

5. `OnOverviewModeWillStart()` is called, but now a no-op



Demo: http://shortn/_nkw7zwgktE



BUG=b/289133203

TEST=launch wallpaper picker in tablet split screen, select a

wallpaper and enter full screen preview, confirm the wallpaper and

verify the wallpaper is set.

TEST=browser_tests --gtest_filter="*WallpaperFullscreen*"



Cq-Include-Trybots: luci.chrome.try:linux-chromeos-chrome

Change-Id: I7a96849ff9f8ac26d6169cca58e0a3df49a5a225

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4742960

Reviewed-by: Xiaohui Chen

entry.title: [scroll-snap] Propagate snap-areas up fragment tree.
entry.content:
Previously we keep a global list (and complex re-targetting logic) to

track all snap-containers (in reality all scrollable-areas), and at

the end of layout - iterated through this global list to ensure the

snap container data was correct.



This is slow! It accounts for ~0.05-0.1% of renderer CPU time, and can

easily blow out to significant time when there are lots of scrollable

areas on a page.



This patch propagates snap-areas up the fragment tree (the complex

re-targetting logic for LayoutBox::SnapContainer, LayoutBox::SnapAreas

isn't required anymore).



When we detect we have snap-areas, within UpdateAfterLayout we enqueue

ourselves for for a snap-update.

(Similarly if a property we are interested changes).



In most cases this results in a very small amount of work, and no

iterating over a global list.



Bug: 504567

entry.title: Add tolerance to IsSnapportCovered computation
entry.content:
The layout code stores compositor scroll nodes' bounds as ints

(gfx::Size) which may be rounded up or down. Rounded-up values create

an issue where the snap code (which stores the snap area rects as

floats) fails to recognize that a snap area covers the snap port. This

happens when the snap port is at the max scroll offset (clamped by

ScrollTree::ClampScrollOffsetToLimits).



This patch addresses this issue by allowing a 0.5 tolerance in the

snap code which checks whether a snap area covers a snap port.



More details at [1]

[1] https://docs.google.com/document/d/17gYIb6lJEe8dOk2xJ5eM_dvbMo3W1aR_jMPouusiyFU

entry.title: [Extensions] Add a "strong worker keepalive" for debugger sessions
entry.content:
Add a strong keepalive for service worker-based extensions when they

have an active debugger session via the chrome.debugger API. This

prevents these workers from timing out for these API calls (though they

can still be terminated for other cases). Note this is distinct from

(and in addition to) the keepalive service workers have for when *they*

are being debugged via an active inspector.



Add a test for the same.
